newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIA ADVANTAGE FUND NAV UP 50.1 PCT - BIRLA CAPITAL.
newsitem.headline: INDIA ADVANTAGE FUND NAV UP 50.1 PCT - BIRLA CAPITAL.

text.p: Birla Capital International AMC said on Wednesday said the net asset value (NAV) of its India Advantage mutual fund rose 50.1 percent to $15.06 from its launch in August 1996.
"The top four sectors represented in the portfolio are software, pharmaceuticals, consumer goods and banking," Birla Capital AMC said in a statement.
The fund's NAV rose to $15.06 as on July 23, 1997 from $10 in August 1996, Birla said.
"During the same period, the BSE sensex and the National share index have moved up by 28.2 percent and 21.6 percent respectively," the statement said.

India Advantage Fund is a $10 million open-ended equity fund based in Mauritius. It is jointly floated by Birla Capital International AMC and Capital International group companies of the United States.

The top 20 stocks in the portfolio were Infosys Technologies, State Bank of India, Punjab Tractors, Procter & Gamble, Burroughs Wellcome, Elgi Tyres, Hoechst Maion Roussel, Hoechst Schering Agrevo, Hindustan Lever, Tata Donelly, HDFC Bank, Ponds India, Cyanamid India, Shriram Honda, Credit Rating Information Services of India (CRISIL), Wyeth Laboratories, Hindustan Ciba, Glaxo, Albright Morarji and Madras Cements as on June 30, 1997.
